Furthermore, it claims to be one of the few European capitals with beautiful scenery and a developed ski-resort so close to it - the Vitosha mountain.

China.Name: Burgas
China.Description: Burgas (also Bourgas) is a city on the Black Sea coast of Bulgaria.

China.Name: Gabrovo
China.Description: Gabrovo (Bulgarian: Габрово) is a city in the Balkan region of Bulgaria.

China.Name: Pleven
China.Description: Pleven (Bulgarian: Плевен [ˈplɛvɛn]), a.k.a Plevna in Romanian, Plevne in Turkish, is a city in North Bulgaria.

China.Name: Plovdiv
China.Description: Plovdiv (Bulgarian: Пловдив) is the second-largest city in Bulgaria, and second oldest (if not the oldest) city in Europe.  It is located in the large plain between the Rhodope Mountains on the south and the Balkan Range (Stara Planina - "Old Mountain") that runs through the center of Bulgaria to the north. Both ranges are visible on clear days.  The Maritsa River flows through the city on its way southeast before forming the Greek/Turkey border to the Aegean Sea.

China.Name: Rousse
China.Description: Rousse  (Bulgarian: Русе) is a city on the south bank of the Danube river, in North Bulgaria.

China.Name: Varna
China.Description:
Varna (Bulgarian: Варна) is the third-largest city in Bulgaria after Sofia and Plovdiv.
Commonly referred to as the marine (or summer) capital of Bulgaria, Varna is a major tourist destination, business and university centre, seaport, and headquarters of the Bulgarian Navy and merchant marine.

China.Name: Veliko Tarnovo
China.Description: Veliko Turnovo (Велико Търново, also transliterated as Veliko Tarnovo) is a mountain city located in the north of Bulgaria.

China.Name: Balkan Mountains
China.Description: Officially called Stara planina (Cyrillic: Стара планина), meaning the old mountain, the Balkan Mountains (or simply The Balkan) are a mountain chain in Bulgaria and Serbia. The Balkan is also a cultural region in Bulgaria that includes specific parts of the mountain and the areas adjacent to them.

China.Name: Dragoman Marsh
China.Description: Dragoman Marsh is a protected karst wetland area in the Shopluk region of Bulgaria.

China.Name: Nature Park Bulgarka
China.Description: Nature Park Bulgarka is a protected national nature park in the central northern part of the Balkan Mountains near the Bulgarian towns of Gabrovo and Tryavna. The park has been protected because of its picturesque mountain landscapes, the variety of rare animals and plants, as well as in the aim of preserving traditional ethnic handcrafts and beliefs in the ethnographic open-air museum complex Etar and in the Dryanovo Monastery.

China.Name: Pirin National Park
China.Description: Pirin is in Pirin Macedonia, in Bulgaria. The range is a national park and since 1983 part of the UNESCO World nature heritage.

China.Name: Rhodope Mountains
China.Description: The Rhodope Mountains, or simply The Rhodopes are a mountain massif and a cultural region in southern Bulgaria (83%) and northern Greece (17%).

China.Name: Ouagadougou
China.Description: Ouagadougou (pronounced: WA-ga-DOO-goo) is the capital of Burkina Faso and the nation's cultural & economic centre. Its name is informally shortened to Ouaga (pronounced: WA-ga).

China.Name: Banfora
China.Description: Banfora is a city in Burkina Faso

China.Name: Bobo-Dioulasso
China.Description: With a population of more than half a million, Bobo-Dioulasso is the second largest city in Burkina Faso.

China.Name: Dédougou
China.Description: Dedougou is a city in Burkina Faso.

China.Name: Gaoua
China.Description: Gaoua is a market town in the Black Volta Region of Burkina Faso.

China.Name: Koudougou
China.Description: Koudougou is the second largest city in the Volta Delta of Burkina Faso.

China.Name: Ouahigouya
China.Description: Ouahigouya is a large town in North Burkina Faso, near the Mali border.

China.Name: W National Park
China.Description: W National Park [dead link] is in a trans-border park, with the most important areas in  Southwestern Niger.

China.Name: Bujumbura
China.Description: Bujumbura is the largest city and capital of Burundi. It is on the north-eastern shore of Lake Tanganyika, the second deepest lake in the world after Lake Baikal.

China.Name: Cibitoke
Bujumbura
China.Description: Bujumbura is the largest city and capital of Burundi. It is on the north-eastern shore of Lake Tanganyika, the second deepest lake in the world after Lake Baikal.

China.Name: Phnom Penh
China.Description: Phnom Penh, at the confluence of the Mekong and the Tonle Sap Rivers, is the capital of Cambodia and its largest city.

China.Name: Banlung
China.Description: Banlung (បានលុង), although a small town, is the capital of Ratanakiri Province in Eastern Cambodia.

China.Name: Battambang
China.Description: Battambang [dead link] is Cambodia's second most populous city, and a popular tourist destination due to the many nearby ancient temples, Buddhist shrines and the infamous bamboo railway. It is also the capital of Battambang Province.

China.Name: Kampot
China.Description: Kampot is a small town (pop.~40,000) in southeast Cambodia and capital of the province of the same name. It is a gateway to Bokor National Park

China.Name: Koh Kong
China.Description: Koh Kong, or Krong Khemarak Phoumin, is the capital of Koh Kong Province in Cambodia's  Cardamom Mountains. It is 8 km from Cham Yeam, which is connected by Cambodia's southernmost Thai border crossing to the Thai town of Hat Lek.

China.Name: Kompong Thom
China.Description: Kampong Thom is the capital of Kampong Thom Province in Cambodia. It's about halfway between Phnom Penh and Siem Reap and thus most travellers only rush through on their way between these two major attractions.

China.Name: Kratie
China.Description: Kratie (ក្រចេះ, pronounced kra-chey) is a tiny town in northeastern Cambodia. Despite its small size, it is the capital of the province of the same name.

China.Name: Siem Reap
China.Description: The town of Siem Reap (សៀមរាប), in northern Cambodia, is the primary access point for the Angkor Archaeological Park.

China.Name: Sihanoukville
China.Description: Sihanoukville (Krong Preah Seihanu), formerly Kompong Som and familiarly just Snookyville or even Snooky is a seaside town featuring Cambodia's best-known beaches.

China.Name: Angkor Archaeological Park
Bokor National Park
China.Description: Bokor National Park is in Cambodia.

China.Name: Kampong Cham
China.Description: Kampong Cham is the seventh largest city in Cambodia and the capital of the province of the same name.

China.Name: Kep
China.Description: Kep is a seaside resort area in Cambodia and includes the small town of the same name which is the capital of Kep Province.

China.Name: Krek
China.Description: Krek (also known as Kraek; pronounced as cry-eek) is a town in the Mekong Lowlands and Central Plains region of Cambodia.

China.Name: Koh Ker
China.Description: Koh Ker is to the north of Siem Reap, Cambodia.

China.Name: Poipet
China.Description: Poipet hosts Cambodia's main border crossing with Thailand, which links northwest Cambodia to Aranyaprathet, and hence Bangkok. Cross-border activity has made the town grow to be larger than its provincial capital, Sisophon.

China.Name: Preah Vihear
China.Description: Prasat Preah Vihear (ព្រះវិហារ) is a Khmer (Cambodian) temple crowning a 525-m cliff in the Dângrêk Mountains in Cambodia, across the border from Si Saket and Kantharalak in northeastern Thailand. It is also the name of the surrounding province.

China.Name: Tonle Sap Lake
China.Description: Tonle Sap Lake is in Cambodia.

China.Name: Yaoundé
China.Description: Yaoundé is the capital of Cameroon, and the country's second most populous city. It is smaller than the economic centre (Douala), but still a bustling city. Called the city on seven hills, Yaoundé is home to people from all over Cameroon.

China.Name: Bafoussam
China.Description: Bafoussam is the capital of the West Region, in Northwest Highlands, Cameroon.

China.Name: Bamenda
China.Description: Bamenda is a city in Cameroon.

China.Name: Buea
China.Description: Buea is a city in Coastal Cameroon.

China.Name: Douala
China.Description: Douala is the largest city and the commercial centre of Cameroon.

China.Name: Garoua
China.Description: Garoua is a port city lying on the Benue River in Northern Cameroon. Third biggest city in Cameroon.

China.Name: Limbe
China.Description: Limbe is in the South West Region of Cameroon. It is a cosmopolitan city with a blend of various cultures which originated due to the hospitality of the people and western influence. This is one of the first cities in Cameroon to get in contact with the whites. The sanitation in Limbe is the best in Cameroon, so it has been nicknamed "clean city".

China.Name: Ngaoundere
China.Description: Ngaoundéré is the capital of Adamaoua region.

China.Name: Dja Faunal Reserve
China.Description: Dja Faunal Reserve, the in the south-eastern part of Cameroon, is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

China.Name: Ngoketunjia
China.Description: Ngoketunjia is a division in the Northwest Highlands region of Cameroon.

China.Name: Ottawa
China.Description: Ottawa is Canada's capital. With a million citizens, it is Canada's sixth-largest city, and Ontario's second-largest city. Across the Ottawa river is Gatineau, Quebec.

China.Name: Calgary
China.Description: Onward!, the official motto of Calgary, is more apt than ever in the wake of the major flooding the city experienced in June 2013. A year later, the casual visitor would have been hard-pressed to find any traces of the flood. As of November 2016, the only changes visitors may notice are the closure of boating through the Harvie Passage section of the Bow River, and a few remaining sections of bike paths that are closed as a result of flood damage or for riverbank stabilization.

China.Name: Halifax (Nova Scotia)
China.Description: Halifax is the capital city of Nova Scotia and the largest city in the Atlantic Provinces of Canada.  The city's origins and rich maritime history derive from a strategic location and one of the world's great natural harbours. In the 19th and early 20th century, Halifax was the entry point for European immigration to Canada. Today, Halifax is a busy Atlantic seaport and the economic and cultural hub of Eastern Canada.

China.Name: Montreal
China.Description: Montreal (French: Montréal) is the largest city in the Quebec province. While Quebec City is the capital, Montreal is the cultural and economic centre, and the main entry point to the province.  With 1.7 million citizens in the city and 4 million in the urban area, Montreal is Canada's second largest city, and the largest francophone city in the Americas. Still, a quarter of the population speak English as a mother language, and most Francophones are conversant in English. Old Montreal has a heritage of colonial times. Though a large city, Montreal gives opportunities for outdoor life, and for watching the legendary Montreal Canadiens ice hockey team.

China.Name: Quebec City
China.Description: Quebec City (French: Ville de Québec, or just Québec) is the capital of the Canadian province of Quebec. Located at a commanding position on cliffs overlooking the St. Lawrence Seaway, Quebec City's Old Town is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of only two cities in North America (the other being Campeche in Mexico) with its original city walls. Quebec is a city of about 700,000 residents.

China.Name: Toronto
China.Description: Toronto is the most populous city in Canada and the provincial capital of Ontario. It is located on the northwestern shore of Lake Ontario. Toronto has a population of 2.7 million, and is the heart of the Greater Toronto Area (GTA) containing 6.4 million people. It also anchors the Golden Horseshoe region, which wraps around Lake Ontario from Toronto to Niagara Falls and totals over 9.2 million residents, approximately a quarter of Canada's entire population. Toronto is the fourth largest city and fifth largest urban agglomeration in North America.

China.Name: Vancouver
China.Description: Vancouver occupies a pretty enviable spot in the world.  Blessed with miles of coastline, lush vegetation and crowned by the North Shore Mountains, it's hard to be there and not stop at some point and be amazed by what you see.

China.Name: Whitehorse
China.Description: Whitehorse is the capital of the Yukon.

China.Name: Winnipeg
China.Description: Winnipeg is Manitoba's capital and largest city, and stands midway on the Trans-Canada highway and railroad. With 700,000 inhabitants, The Peg dominates the  Canadian Prairies and is as diverse as the whole of Canada.

China.Name: Algonquin Park
China.Description: Algonquin Park, the largest park in the Ontario  Provincial Parks System, borders Eastern and Central Ontario.

China.Name: Banff National Park
China.Description: Banff National Park is in the Alberta Rockies region of Alberta, Canada. Together with six other national parks it makes up the UNESCO World Heritage site "Canadian Rocky Mountain Parks".

China.Name: Cape Breton Island
China.Description: Cape Breton Island is the northernmost island in Nova Scotia.

China.Name: Jasper National Park
China.Description: Jasper National Park is in the Alberta Rockies region of Alberta, Canada.  It has been named a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The park is the largest of Canada's Rocky Mountain Parks, spanning 10,878 km² (4200 square miles) of broad valleys, rugged mountains, glaciers, forests, alpine meadows and wild rivers along the eastern slopes of the Rockies in western Alberta. There are more than 1200 km (660 miles) of hiking trails (both overnight and day trips), and a number of spectacular mountain drives.

China.Name: Terra Nova National Park
China.Description: Terra Nova National Park is in Eastern Newfoundland. It joined Canada's National Parks system in 1957. It is Canada's most easterly national park. Terra Nova is an excellent way to experience the nature, discovery and adventure of eastern Newfoundland. It is a place where sheltered Atlantic fjords stretch inland to touch the boreal landscape.

China.Name: Waterton Lakes National Park
China.Description: Waterton Lakes National Park is the Canadian portion of Waterton Glacier International Peace Park, a UNESCO World Heritage site which extends into the US as Glacier National Park.

China.Name: Yoho National Park
China.Description: Yoho National Park is British Columbia's sister to Alberta's Banff National Park, a world heritage site, and located on the western side of the continental divide that separates the two provinces.  It is about 2½ hour's drive west of Calgary, Alberta.  Yoho is Canada's second protected area.

China.Name: Praia
China.Description: Praia — literally "Beach" in Portuguese — is Cape Verde's capital and busiest city. While it's maybe not comparable to a western metropolis, with a population of only about 130,000 (2010 census), one in four Cape Verdeans call the city home and the city is an important thoroughfare for international visitors to the archipelagic country.

China.Name: Mindelo
China.Description: Mindelo [dead link] is on the island of São Vicente. Mindelo is the cultural capital of Cape Verde. You'll hear traditional music commonly played in bars and restaurants around town.

China.Name: Cidade Velha
China.Description: Cidada Velha is a city on the island of Santiago, Cape Verde. It is the oldest European city in the Tropics. This is an easy half-day trip from Praia although there probably won't be enough interest to keep you there any longer. It was declared a UNESCO World Heritage site in 2009.

China.Name: São Filipe
China.Description: São Filipe is a city on the island of Fogo.

China.Name: Bangui
Mbaiki
China.Description: Mbaiki is the main city in the southern part of the Central African Republic.

China.Name: Bambari
China.Description: Bambari Is the third largest city in the Central African Republic, lying on the Ouaka River. It is an important market town and is also home to an airport.

China.Name: Bangassou
China.Description: Bangassou is the capital of the Mbomou prefecture in the Central African Republic. Situated on the river Mbomou and at a stones-throw  from the border with the neighbouring Democratic Republic of the Congo, Bangassou has been repeatedly tangled up in rebellion fights, including as recently as 2013.

China.Name: Birao
China.Description: Birao is a remote and out of the way place in the very north of the Central African Republic. It is close to the Chad and Sudan border so there is some trade going on but mostly the place suffers from lack of government attention and money.

China.Name: Bouar
China.Description: The Central African Republic (French: République centrafricaine or Centrafrique, Sangho: Ködörösêse tî Bêafrîka) is at the geographic center of Africa, bordered by Cameroon to the west, Chad to the north, Sudan and South Sudan to the east, and the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Republic of the Congo to the south.

China.Name: Dzanga Sangha National Reserve
China.Description: Dzanga Sangha National Reserve is in Southwest Region of Central African Republic.

China.Name: Manovo-Gounda St. Floris National Park
China.Description: This park in the Central African Republic is on the UNESCO World Heritage List.

China.Name: N'Djamena
China.Description: N'Djamena is the capital of Chad. It is by far the country's largest city, with a population of 1 million people. It lies directly on the border of Cameroon, and is located on the confluence of the Chari and Logone rivers. The city has been at the centre of many heated rebellions and revolts, and in February 2008 was entered by rebel troops.

China.Name: Moundou
China.Description: Moundou is a city in the Soudanian region of Chad.

China.Name: Abéché
China.Description: Abeche is the capital of Ouaddai Province in Chad. It was once the capital of the Wadai Empire.

China.Name: Faya
China.Description: Faya, also known as Faya-Largeau a city in Saharan Chad.

China.Name: Santiago de Chile
China.Description: Santiago is the capital and economic center of Chile. With its many museums, events, theaters, restaurants, bars and other entertainment and cultural opportunities, it is also the political and cultural center of the country. Its central location in the country makes it a great base for visiting other areas, and it is possible to ski in the nearby Andes and later be on the beach in the same day.

China.Name: Concepción
China.Description: Concepción is the second largest city of Chile with a population of almost 227,000 (out of Concepción province's 946,000) as of 2016. It is on the coast of Southern Chile.

China.Name: Iquique
China.Description: Iquique is in the Northern Chile. City  home to the duty free zone called "Zofri" and a growing number of high rise resort hotels along its beaches. Slightly more expensive and polluted than neighboring population centers, such as Arica, but a convenient place to stock up on duty free perfumes and laptop computers.

China.Name: La Serena
China.Description: La Serena is a charming town in Northern Chile. There is a lot to see and do nearby.

China.Name: Punta Arenas
China.Description: Punta Arenas is the regional capital of the Magallanes y Antártica Region located in Chilean Patagonia. Punta Arenas (formerly Punta Arenosa, "Sandy Point") is located on the Brunswick Peninsula and was founded in the 17th century by Englishman J. Byron who gave it the name of Sandy Point. With a population of around 125,000 (2015), it is the largest settlement on the Strait of Magellan and is located 1418 km from the coast of Antarctica. The history and economic growth of the city is based on maritime commerce, oil extraction, and sheep breeding.

China.Name: San Pedro de Atacama
China.Description: San Pedro de Atacama is a town in Northern Chile.

China.Name: Valdivia
China.Description: Valdivia is in Southern Chile.

China.Name: Valparaíso
China.Description: Valparaíso is a city of around 300,000 on the Pacific coast of Central Chile.  Frequently referred to as simply Valpo, it is located approximately 120 km west of the capital, Santiago de Chile.  The city is widely known for its bohemian culture, brightly colored houses, and beautiful seaside views.

China.Name: Vina del Mar
China.Description: Viña del Mar is in Central Chile and is a beach resort town close to Santiago de Chile. It's the most important beach in the country.  It plays host to a famous music festival every year in mid-February.

China.Name: Chiloé Island
China.Description: Chiloé Island (Spanish: Isla de Chiloé) is in Southern Chile, off-shore from the northern Patagonian regions of Los Lagos and Aysén.

China.Name: Laguna San Rafael National Park
China.Description: Laguna San Rafael National Park is a park on the Pacific coast of  Patagonia in Chile.

China.Name: Lauca National Park
China.Description: Lauca National Park is an 1379 km² protected area in Northern Chile. It's located in the Andean range and is characterized by volcanic mountains. It's also a good place to spot many typically Andean animals, from alpacas and llamas to flamingos and – if you're lucky – condors.

China.Name: Pichilemu
China.Description: Pichilemu [dead link] is a holiday town with beaches in Central Chile, south of Valparaíso.

China.Name: Robinson Crusoe Island
China.Description: Juan Fernández Islands is a small island archipelago off the coast of Central Chile.

China.Name: Torres del Paine National Park
China.Description: Torres del Paine is a national park in Chilean Patagonia. It is in the southern tiers of the Andes and features mountains, lakes, and glaciers.

China.Name: Valle de Elqui
China.Description: The Northern region of Chile is among the driest regions in the world.

China.Name: Valle de la Luna
China.Description: San Pedro de Atacama is a town in Northern Chile.

China.Name: Villarrica
China.Description: Villarrica is in Araucanía.

China.Name: Beijing
China.Description: Beijing (北京 Běijīng) is China's capital, and its second largest city after Shanghai, with a population of more than 20 million. It has been the capital of the Chinese Empire for much of its history, and became seat of the People's Republic of China after the Chinese revolutions, as well as the country's educational and cultural center.

China.Name: Guangzhou
China.Description: Guangzhou (广州; Gwóngjāu in Cantonese, Guǎngzhōu in Mandarin, traditional English name: Canton) is the capital of Guangdong Province in southern China.

China.Name: Guilin
China.Description: Guilin (桂林; Guì​lín) and the surrounding region are among the most scenic areas in China and the most popular tourist destinations both for Chinese travellers and the international backpacker set. The main attraction is the karst terrain, limestone mountains eroded into fantastic shapes. Apart from its sheer visual beauty, karst terrain also provides many cliffs suitable for rock climbing and many caves.

China.Name: Hangzhou
China.Description: Hangzhou (杭州; ɦaŋ-tsei in Wu, Hángzhōu in Mandarin) is in Zhejiang Province, China. It is one of the most important tourist cities in China, famous for its natural beauty and historical and cultural heritage.

China.Name: Kunming
China.Description: Kunming (昆明; Kūnmíng) is the capital of Yunnan Province in China. Known in China as the City of Eternal Spring, Kunming is at an almost-tropical latitude but with a 2000 m (6600 ft) altitude, which gives it a very temperate climate. However, in winter it has been known to snow, so if visiting in December–February, pack warm. Also, when it rains - it's cold.

China.Name: Nanjing
China.Description:
Nanjing (南京; Nánjīng), historically also Nanking, is the capital city of Jiangsu Province in China.
It is situated in the lower reaches of the Yangtze River and is the central city of the lower Yangtze Basin.

China.Name: Shanghai
China.Description: Shanghai (上海; Zånhae in Shanghainese, Shànghǎi in Mandarin) is the largest and most developed city in China, the country's main center for finance and fashion, and one of the world's most populous and important cities.

China.Name: Suzhou
China.Description: Suzhou [dead link] (苏州; Sou-tseü in Wu, Sūzhōu in Mandarin) is a city in Jiangsu province, famed for its beautiful gardens and traditional waterside architecture. The town has many canals and has been called the Venice of the East. An older romanisation was "Soochow".

China.Name: Xi'an
China.Description: Xi'an (西安 Xī'ān) is a city in Shaanxi Province in China. The oldest surviving capital of ancient China, Xi'an is home to thousands of years of Chinese heritage and history.

China.Name: Great Wall of China
China.Description: The Great Wall of China (长城 Chángchéng) is a wall that stretches from Liaoning Province through Hebei Province, Tianjin Municipality, Beijing Municipality, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, Shanxi Province, Shaanxi Province, and Ningxia Autonomous Region into Gansu Province within the country of China.

China.Name: Hainan
China.Description: Hainan (海南, Hǎinán) is an island and the southernmost province of China, south of Guangdong province and across the Gulf of Tonkin from Vietnam. "Hainan" literally means "South of the Ocean". It has a thriving tourist industry and is being heavily promoted as "China's Hawaii".

China.Name: Jiuzhaigou Nature Reserve
China.Description: Jiuzhaigou (九寨沟 Jiǔzhàigōu) is a nature reserve in the north of Sichuan province in south western China. It is officially known as Jiuzhai Valley in English. It is known as the habitat of giant pandas and for its many multi-level waterfalls and colorful lakes. It was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1992. It belongs to the category V (Protected Landscape) in the IUCN system of protected area categorization.

China.Name: Leshan
China.Description: Leshan (乐山; Lèshān) is a city near in Sichuan Province. Sitting on the confluence of the Dadu, Mín and Qingyi rivers it is most famous for its huge riverside cliff-carving of Buddha and nearby Mount Emei; which together are a World Heritage Site.

China.Name: Mount Tai
China.Description: Mount Tai (泰山 Tài Shān) is a sacred mountain in Shandong, China, and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

China.Name: Tibet
China.Description: Tibet (Classical Tibetan: Bod; (བོད་), Lhasa dialect: Pö; Mandarin Chinese: 西藏, Xīzàng) is sometimes described as the "roof of the world"; the entire region is on a high plateau and there are many large mountains. The area has its own unique culture, and most travellers will find some of the plants, wildlife and domestic animals quite exotic as well. Entering Tibet you feel as though you've found an entirely different world.

China.Name: Turpan
China.Description: Turpan (Chinese: 吐魯番, Tǔlǔfān; Uyghur: تۇرپان‎, Turpan; Turkish: Turfan) is a city in Xinjiang, on the Silk Road.
